p: A novel 3D representation of DNA sequences was proposed by Li et al. ( 2016). If the bases are represented by a set {A, G, C, T}, they graphically characterised a sequence in terms of nucleotide pairs by taking two combinations of the set in terms of a multiset {∞. A, ∞. G, ∞. C, ∞. T}. The possible number of such pairs can be ten (Table 9.17).
